page.title: 15EISTEDDFOD PROCLAMATION RHYL
page.content: During August 1985 the home of our National Eisteddfod will be Rhyl and District. The Eisteddfod will be held on the outskirts of Rhuddlan, 3 miles from Rhyl. This site was the only one acceptable to the organisers and the police who will have the difficult task of controlling all traffic. The 1985 National Eisteddfod was proclaimed 12 months ago by the Gorsedd of Bards. The proclamation took place within the Gorsedd Circle on the promenade. This circle consists of 12 stone pillars. A large flat topped stone, known as the "Maen Llog" lies at the centre of the circle and provides a platform from which the Archdruid conducted the ceremony. Facing it is the stone of the Covenant at which the Herald Bard stood. Behind this are the Portal stones which were guarded by Eisteddfod officials.
